content: the sts in the first colour make sure the last st is still purled with both strands woodruff page 3 having completed all 31 row of the chart turn the heel as follows all through the heel turn main- tain the established 1x1 stripe row1 sl1 work in the established pattern for 19 sts ssk k1 turn leaving 12 sts unworked row2 sl1 p6 p2tog p1 turn again leaving 12 sts unworked row3 sl1 k to 1 st before gap ssk k1 turn row4 sl1 p to 1 st before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 and 4 until you have used up all the sts either side you should be ready to work a k row with 21 sts on your needle using needle2 k11 this is the centre back gusset using the gusset chart work the 10 sts on needle 1 according to pattern row 1 still following the chart pick up and k 17 sts down the side of the heel flap taking care that you pick up both strands of the slipped sts you will pick up one more st than you would normally do but you should find that you have just enough loops m1 in the gap before the instep sts this is marked in the chart work the instep sts according to the chart the blue line in the chart indicates where the division between needle 1 and 2 should be m1 in the gap after the instep sts and pick up and k 17 sts up the other side of the flap following the chart sequence work the last 11 sts to the centre back work the gusset according to the chart until you have finished all 36 rounds of the chart you will decrease 2 sts every 3 rounds either side of the centre front st after round 36 of the gusset chart you are back with your initial 72 sts foot continue working the foot chart until you have reached about 5 cm / 2 inches before your total foot length make sure you end after a full repeat of the chart i e after round 6 or the toe chart will not line up toe work the partial round 1 of the toe chart this will bring you to the side of the sock and this is the new start of the round please note that the two sts marked in red are not to be worked but slipped as if to purl work all 26 rounds of the toe chart ending with 18 sts total cut yarns leaving about 10 inches / 25 cms and graft the toe closed using colour 1 turn sock inside out and darn in all loose threads work a second sock the same way but feel free to invert the colours if you feel so inclined woodruff page 4 further options - if you find the cuff in solid ribbing to heavy for the sock maybe use a striped rib instead or
